meanings.definition: To smile more than someone else in a competitive or confrontational manner.
meanings.sent1: She was outsmiling her opponent during the game.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outsmile his colleagues in meetings.
meanings.sent3: The outsmiling contest between the siblings was getting intense.
meanings.sent4: Her bright smile outshone the competition, truly outsmiling them all.
meanings.sent5: In the battle of smiles, she emerged victorious by outsmiling everyone around.

meanings.definition: The act of smiling more than someone else in a competitive or confrontational manner.
meanings.sent1: His outsmiling of others often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: The outsmiling at the party was hard to miss.
meanings.sent3: The outsmiling at the negotiation table made the atmosphere lighter.
meanings.sent4: Her outsmiling was like a beacon of positivity in the room.
meanings.sent5: The outsmiling in the photograph captured the essence of the moment perfectly.
